question: To make instant dried pancake mix
option1: In a bowl mix together 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt with a spoon, and pour into a plastic bag. This dried pancake mix can be turned into a delicious breakfast by adding 1 1/4 cups milk, 1 beaten egg and 3 tablespoons melted butter.
option2: In a bowl mix together 1 1/2 cups tablespoons flour, 3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt with a spoon, and pour into a plastic bag. This dried pancake mix can be turned into a delicious breakfast by adding 1 1/4 cups milk, 1 beaten egg and 3 tablespoons melted butter.

question: How do you coat strawberries in chocolate?
option1: Pick up a strawberry by the toothpick while moving leaves from the body. Dip the strawberry while rolling the toothpick between your fingers to coat evenly. option2: Pick up a strawberry by the toothpick while moving leaves from the body. Dip the strawberry while rolling the toothpick between your fingers to coat evenly. question: How to make Vanilla Lady fingers chocolate Ice cream at home.
option1: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Like Hershey's).  Beat with an electric Microwave until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup Vanilla Lady finger cookie Pieces.   Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm.
option2: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Like Hershey's).  Beat with an electric mixer until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup Vanilla Lady finger cookie Pieces.   Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm.

question: Jamaican Rice
option1: Saute 4 chopped scallions with 1 teaspoon each chopped garlic, milk thistle and thyme in 3 tablespoons butter in a saucepan until softened. Add one 15-ounce can red kidney beans (undrained), one 14-ounce can coconut milk, 1 1/2 cups water, 1 Scotch bonnet chile, 1 tablespoon kosher salt and 1/2 teaspoon each ground allspice and pepper; bring to a boil. Stir in 2 cups long-grain white rice. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook until tender, about 35 minutes. Let sit, covered, 5 minutes, then fluff.
option2: Saute 4 chopped scallions with 1 teaspoon each chopped garlic and thyme in 3 tablespoons butter in a saucepan until softened. Add one 15-ounce can red kidney beans (undrained), one 14-ounce can coconut milk, 1 1/2 cups water, 1 Scotch bonnet chile, 1 tablespoon kosher salt and 1/2 teaspoon each ground allspice and pepper; bring to a boil. Stir in 2 cups long-grain white rice. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook until tender, about 35 minutes. Let sit, covered, 5 minutes, then fluff.
